nodes.bodyText: can this width 100% be on the actual component itself (preventing the use of named class)?
I don't think so - this is here because the 100% width needs to be applied to the tab-pane, and I couldn't figure out another way to style the element nested inside the tab.
for initialization type code, especially if it contains loops is better to be contained in a useEffect so it only executes when it needs to
That is a good call. Moved to a useEffect!
can you investigate to see if perhaps using material-ui button icons would be easy to style? this would prevent additional disabled styling and onClick handling
edge case to test would be how overflow will be handled for the tabs (if there are a lot of inputs our outputs)
Good call out! I've added styling to make sure the tabs scroll if there is overflow.
is this empty intentional or should there be some message?
This shouldn't be there at all - I've removed this If component.
